intro: Irlbachia alata subsp. viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered winged iris, is a member of the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, wing-like petals that extend from the base of the flower. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. Its flowers are usually greenish or yellowish, with a subtle fragrance. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade.
